description: Numbers that are congruent to {0, 1, 9} mod 10.
links: Robert Israel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
Index entries for linear recurrences with constant coefficients, signature (1,0,1,-1).
formula: G.f.: x^2*(x^2+8*x+1)/((x-1)^2*(x^2+x+1)). - _Robert Israel_, Feb 23 2016a(n) = a(n-1)+a(n-3)-a(n-4) for n>3. - _Vincenzo Librandi_, Feb 24 2016
mathematica: Select[Range[0, 200], MemberQ[{0, 1, 9}, Mod[#, 10]] &] (* or *) LinearRecurrence[{1, 0, 1, -1}, {0, 1, 9, 10}, 60] (* _Vincenzo Librandi_, Feb 24 2016 *)
prog: (MAGMA) [n: n in [0..200] | n mod 10 in [0,1,9]]; // _Vincenzo Librandi_, Feb 24 2016
author: _Henry Bottomley_, May 24 2000
